metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000071 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
roundcube version 1.3.4 and earlier contains an Insecure Permissionsvulnerability in enigma plugin that can result in exfiltration of gpgprivate key. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000071` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

roundcube - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-core - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-mysql - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-pgsql - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-plugins - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-sqlite3 - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: roundcube package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.3+dfsg.1-1').
